title: Song from the last level of Keen 5
content:
Hey, I was just playing through keen 5 again today, and I noticed something...

Isn't the song in the last level copied from "The Planets" by Gustav Holst? Did anyone else notice this?

title: Re: Song from the last level of Keen 5
content:
Yes, and yes. I didn't notice it personally, but it's been discussed here, so someone must have.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/toughyorp.png[/img]

title: Re: Song from the last level of Keen 5
content:
You are 100% correct! The song is copied directly off of "Mars, The Bringer of War." "[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Planets]The Planets[/url]" isn't one song but actually a series of songs. The one you are talking about is, "Mars, The Bringer of War," which is the first, and most popular, song in the series.

I never ever made the connection until I read your post. I always thought the beginning was familiar but I couldn't place it. The beginning of the two songs are almost identical.

Awesome connection there.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/Blegdandsmeegdbanner60copy.gif[/img][/url]

title: well...
content:
The big difference is that the .IMF's file format can only have a certain number of notes (I believe playing at once; anything beyond that cuts out and is lost. Bobby Prince explained that on his site, (which, last I checked, was down,) citing the drum track in "Jazz Me" (also from Keen5) as sounding unusual when heard on its own.

"Mars, the Bringer of War" is a gigantic symphonic work involving several dozens of musicians all playing at incredible volume... something that 8 little music notes sounding at once can't possibly emulate.

title: Re: Song from the last level of Keen 5
content:
Well I'll be!

I did always think it was familiar!

Must listen to all of em again.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

-Levellord

title: Re: Song from the last level of Keen 5
content: Heh, I've seen at least twice someone popping up the same info. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Personally I didn't even know about the symphony or whatever before hearing that in some topic. If I remember correct I have heard it (at least we have it on cd or vinyl) but I can't remember it.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Song from the last level of Keen 5
content:
I think someone in my family owned some c.d with Mars on it at one point. I remember discovering those songs when someone else commented on Mars and the Q.E.D song sounding alike a few years ago.

Fun song, that. I wonder if there was a reason behind Bobby using the song, or if he just liked how it sounded...--------------
